result.execSummary:
The defendant Marilyn L Mihai was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $250+ costs = $768, Cash bond to be applied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marilyn L Mihai

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: allowing the COC to adjust the Fine total to $768

Case called at 3:35pm 
Defendant Marilyn L Mihai in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the State, Count #1 is read in and dismissed

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $250+ costs = $778, Cash bond be applied.
recess: 3:56

Defendant Marilyn L Mihai in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
recess: 2:50pm

Cases 15CM83 and 15CM407 called together at 2:01pm [mo]
Defendant Marilyn L Mihai in court.   
Defendant Samuel Martin in court. 
ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court gives both Defendants their right to counsel
The Court gives constructive waiver of counsel warnings to both Defendants 

As to Case 15CM407(Martin)
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Martin. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Recess in both cases at 2:07pm

The Court reconvenes in case 15CM83(Mihai):
Ms. Mihai indicates that she would like counsel; the Court schedules an AIA
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

The Court maintains the already set $800 CASH bond, adds the conditions:
--No Contact with Daniel Peters
--No Discussion of the Facts of this case with Gary Rushing
--No Presence at Highway Harry's Restaurant
recess: 2:26pm 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 12/15/15 at 2:00pm
Bond Payment Information, with West Allis PD Bond Record Form and TTY between JESO and West Allis PD
Duplicate original warrant returned//bond posted at West Allis PD
Ms. Mihai may post $800 cash and be given a new hearing date and time, and then be released as long as the new hearing date/time is written on the bond form.

[MK] case called at 3:19pm. 
Defendant Marilyn L Mihai not in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court summarizes the information on a fax received by court staff yesterday, 4/13/15.  The fax contains information that Ms. Mihai is out of state.
The Court declines the Defendant's request to appear by telephone, or to enter a plea by phone or in writing. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant for the arrest of the Defendant--statewide only. This Warrant is to include a provision that Ms. Mihai may post $800 cash and be given a new hearing date and time, and then be released as long as the new hearing date/time is written on the bond form. 
recess 3:22pm.
